questions.question_text: Which statement is true about cloning a volume?

choices.A: You can clone a volume in another region.
choices.C: A cloned volume is the same as a snapshot that has a dependency on the source volume.
choices.D: You can change the block volume size when cloning a volume.
choices.B: You need to detach a volume before cloning it.

discussion.content: D is the ans, while creating cloning u can able to increase disk size

D is correct, you can change change the block volume size when cloning a volume.

You can't clone a volume to another region or AD.

choices.D: Internet and virtual cloud network (VCN) resolver

discussion.content: C and D is the right answer

questions.question_text: Which two options are available when configuring DNS resolution for your virtual cloud network? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Answer is A. Filter events by request action types
Filter by the request action types

In Request Actions Types, select "DELETE" and click Search.

The list filters to show only DELETE events. Scan the list to find your VCN termination event.

choices.B: Create a serial console connection to the DB System that does not appear in the management console. Connect to the serial console connection, and then
choices.A: Navigate to the Audit console and search the previous 24 hours for all Delete actions to get a list of any resource that was deleted in the past 24 hours.
choices.D: Navigate to the Audit console and search the previous 24 hours for all List actions to get a list of every event that occurred in the past 24 hours.
choices.C: View the service limits associated with your account to ensure that you have not exceeded the allowable number of DB System in your tenancy.

questions.question_text:
You have been notified of an application failure indicating that one or more of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) resources have become unavailable. After scanning the Compute and Database consoles, you notice that one of the DB Systems is missing.
What would you do to identify the reason for this missing resource?
Which two statements are true about data guard service on DB Systems in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Data guard configuration on the OCI is limited to a virtual machine only.
choices.A: Data guard implementation requires two DB Systems, one running the primary database on a virtual machine and the standby database running on bare metal.
choices.D: Both DB Systems must use the same VCN, and port 1521 must be open.
choices.B: Data guard implementation requires two DB Systems, one containing the primary database and one containing the standby database.

discussion.content:
B and D is the right answer.
I saw it in the practice set

A is correct : If your primary and standby databases are in the same region, then both must use the same virtual cloud network (VCN).
If your primary and standby databases are in different regions, then you must peer the virtual cloud networks (VCNs) for each database. See Remote VCN Peering using an RPC.
B is wrong because ; This is only applicable to Bare Metal and Virtual Machine DB systems.

C is correct - An Oracle Data Guard implementation requires two DB systems, one containing the primary database and one containing the standby database. When you enable Oracle Data Guard for a virtual machine DB system database, a new DB system with the standby database is created and associated with the primary database. For a bare metal DB system, the DB system with the database that you want to use as the standby must already exist before you enable Oracle Data Guard.

FInal Ans A,C

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/dbcs/doc/use-oracle-data-guard-db-system.html

B)
“An Oracle Data Guard implementation requires two DB systems, one containing the primary database and one containing the standby database. ”
D)
“The egress rules in the example show how to enable TCP traffic only for port 1521, which is a minimum requirement for Oracle Data Guard to work. “
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Tasks/usingdataguard.htm

NOT A, NOT C)
“This procedure is only applicable to bare metal and virtual machine DB systems. ”

A. Data guard implementation requires two DB Systems, one running the primary database on a virtual machine and the standby database running on bare metal
B. Data guard configuration on the OCI is limited to one standby database per primary database
C. Data guard configuration on the OCI is limited to a virtual machine only
D. Data guard implementation requires two DB Systems, one containing the primary database and one containing the standby database

choices.B: The parallelism of batch job depends on the number of ADW databases involved in the query.
choices.C: The new batch job is connected to LOW consumer group.
choices.D: The new batch job runs on database tables that are not enabled for parallel execution.
choices.E: Parallelism on the database is controlled by the application, not the database.
choices.A: The batch job depends on only one table and parallelism cannot be enabled on single-table queries.

discussion.content:
C
The basic characteristics of these consumer groups are:
HIGH: Highest resources, lowest concurrency. Queries run in parallel.
MEDIUM: Less resources, higher concurrency. Queries run in parallel.
LOW: Least resources, highest concurrency. Queries run serially.

questions.question_text:
You are running your warehouse using Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) service and you noticed that a newly configured batch job is always running in serial even though nothing else is running in the database. All your jobs are configured to run with parallelism enabled.
What could be the reason for this batch job to run in serial?
